article.p: Due to the "Stay At Home Order" the Fine Arts Festival was cancelled. The District Art Teachers put together this digital art show to showcase the Miamisburg students' art work. Enjoy!

a.title: Email this link to a friend

p.img: The 2019-2020 Mirus Yearbook is still available for preorder and features full coverage of this school year! Books are scheduled to arrive in August and all senior yearbooks will still be mailed home at no additional cost. Preordering is only available through May 15; very few additional copies will be ordered. Books are $75 and can be preordered by visiting jostensyearbooks.com or calling 877-767-5217. Please contact jhoutzgillman@miamisburg.k12.oh.us with any questions.

h2.a: MHS Teacher Earns James Madison Fellowship

a.title: Print article < MHS Teacher Earns James Madison Fellowship >
Email this link to a friend

article.p: Amy Elsass has been teaching at Miamisburg City Schools for the past 15 years The last 9 years have been at Miamisburg High School. She currently teaches PLS 1120 American Federal Government through Sinclair Community College and World Religions. Amy has a Bachelor of Arts in History from Wright State University, a Master in Education and Allied Professions from the University of Dayton and is CCP certified through Ashland University. After starting the program at Ashland, she was forced to put her goal to achieve a Masters of Arts degree on hold. With the encouragement of a fellow educator, she decided to apply for the James Madison Fellowship. “The James Madison Memorial Fellowship Foundation offers a scholarship to individuals desiring to become outstanding teachers of the American Constitution at the secondary school level. Their goal is to transform outstanding educators into Constitutional scholars by providing up to $24,000 to earn an MA with an emphasis on constitutional studies.” The Fellowship will provide her the resources needed to finish the Master of Arts in American History and Government (MAHG program) at Ashland. Amy said, "I believe that American government is the most important class a student can take in high school because it not only exposes them to the principles of our government, but it also demonstrates the enormous responsibility we have as people living in the United States to uphold the Constitution. With the help of the James Madison Fellowship, I want to instill a desire in my students to be an active and informed participant in society and then to develop critical thinking skills needed to achieve this."

div.p: The Miamisburg City School District has an excellent staff. We want to recognize our staff's everyday accomplishments. Employees nominate a staff member who exemplifies 40 Assets by supporting the healthy development of our students or a staff member who demonstrates Best Practices. Selected staff members are recognized at a board meeting, on this website, on the District calendar or in the Viking Voice. Throughout this school year, our community will be able to read about some of the things our staff do to "Make A Difference". The latest Making A Difference honorees for school year 2019-2020 are MMS Sub Chris House (nominated by MMS Team 2), and MMS Assistant Principal Sommer Mastronardi (nominated by Myra Downing).

div.p: The Miamisburg City School District will foster a positive, nurturing, and safe environment to inspire and support ongoing learning and the development of individuals as productive members of society.
